title: St Gregory's College, Lagos
text:
St. Gregory's College, Lagos, is a catholic missionary school for boys, with <a href="Boarding%20school">boarding</a> facilities, located 1.0 km from <a href="Tafawa%20Balewa%20Square">Tafawa Balewa Square</a> in the vicinity of <a href="Ikoyi">Ikoyi</a> – <a href="Obalende">Obalende</a>, <a href="Lagos%20State">Lagos State</a>, Nigeria.
History.
The college, originally a <a href="coed">coed</a> campus before the creation of its sister school <a href="Holy%20Child%20College%20Obalende">Holy Child College Obalende</a>, is based in South-West Ikoyi. It was established through the <a href="Catholic%20Church%20in%20Nigeria">Catholic mission</a> in 1928 and named after <a href="Pope%20St.%20Gregory%20the%20Great">Pope St. Gregory the Great</a> (540–604). Entrepreneur <a href="Michael%20Ibru">Michael Ibru</a> and his construction outfit "Ace Jomona" took part in the building of the school.
In the latter part of the 1990s, during the encouragement of internet use by innovators and governing bodies in the <a href="western%20hemisphere">western hemisphere</a>, a class of 1997 alum and <a href="early%20adopter">early adopter</a> technologist <a href="Ade%20Olufeko">Ade Olufeko</a>, built the college's first and most recognisable online presence through <a href="HTML">HTML</a> and <a href="Common%20Gateway%20Interface">CGI</a> programming in the year 1998, based on the need to assist alumni connect with each other globally. Subsequently, as the city of <a href="Lagos">Lagos</a> embraced the digital economy, alumni from different graduating sets, and the school's administration eventually established an official website in 2018.
Athletics.
Saint Gregory's most notable sports teams have been its <a href="cricket">cricket</a> and <a href="Football%20%28word%29">football</a> squads.
